messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Water buffalo tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: Milt, I had an unsigned guard with a Kaneie style design a long time ago that had iron and iroe like this.  I m not sure if it was by the Saga group or by
messages.messageBody:
Milt,
I had an unsigned guard with a Kaneie style design a long time ago that had iron and iroe like this. I'm not sure if it was by the Saga group or by someone else.

For Jakushi you'd expect to see nunome zogan. It looks a bit better than the so-called "Mito-Shoami" shiiremono, but is probably in that bag. I have followed up on that and I agree with Cary that there is no proof of the existence of a Mito Shoami group. It was a handy label for the auction business, but I think we should avoid it going forward. I still think that those guards probably do have an association with the Shoami because of the similarity of some of them to signed pieces like this one:

http://tinyurl.com/ng6e
http://tinyurl.com/ng6h

Jim
-


Gang,
talking about water buffalo..............here's a tsuba with water
buffalo
klick..........http://tinyurl.com/ncvk


question...... what schoo ?
1. Jakushi ( on a good day ) ?
2. Mito ?
3. the all purpose Shoami ?

This would be a good example of " Mito Shoami " before we realise
that school may or may not exist ?

milt
